text: The play was no more than a figment of the imagination which asked the viewer to believe in a beautiful ghost. It would have been an impossible piece of television but for clever production by Michael Hayes. He captured the atmosphere of fog and mystery to great effect. MORE than 100 reviewers complained to the BBC last night that an American film, "Britain - Blood, Sweat, and Tears... Plus Twenty Years, was anti-British.
